ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Too much lecture and reliance on powerpoint slides. When discussion occurred it was forced. The material is interesting and this course could be great with a little tweaking.

The course is essential for MFs or MEMs with an interest in forestry. The material could have been presented in a much more interesting way, though, with more attention given to students' different backgrounds and levels of experience (it was a small enough class that this was possible). Reading discussions were a good interactive experience but more direction or interaction might have spurred better discourse and deeper understanding of the material.

It would have been great to have another field trip with only our class. The combined field trip with the taxonomy class wasn't all that helpful. I found the field examples included in the tests very helpful and it would have been great to work through similar examples during class.
Learning about forests, especially on the field trip.
The lectures were well structured and Ann teaches you everything you need to know about stand dynamics. The field trip was well run and helpful for understanding the lecture material.
The material is fascinating. Ann's reading list for the class is excellent.
The lecture slides were very detailed and good to study from.
Field trips.

The best thing about this course was the chance to get out in the forest and observe the actual material we were learning. Also, the sheer amount of material we covered was well paced and well connected.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Directions for the final project could have been more clearly articulated.

Another field trip later in the semester would have been helpful. The one field trip we did have was early enough in the semester that I'm not sure if I got as much out of it as I could have if it had been a little later.Ann made time for discussion with classes dedicated to it but with the literature we are reading in the class its hard to just sit down and say what you thought of the papers you read. Maybe assign a couple students to lead discussion and give a presentation on the readings? Something to make discussion sections more interesting and help us understand the material better.
The instructor read from the slides during lectures, which made them boring and un-engaging. We only went on one field trip, which isn't enough for a class about stand dynamics.

Expectations for assignments, such as the term paper, were unclear. Better, explicit written instructions are necessary.Could have used more time in the field. Lectures are necessary, but forest dynamics need to be observed/studied in the woods more than one day/semester.
Lectures.

TA - not always informed about the material covered in class. Somewhat available, but didn't always have answers to basic course questions (or explanations could have been clearer).Teaching style - hard to learn from powerpoints only. Also, a lot of material is discussed for each slide, but there was rarely time to note it all down. Maybe more explanations on the blackboard etc. which might be helpful on exams as well.

I think this course could use some assignments that might drive home the material a little better. The literature review was helpful in understanding the topic we chose but it might be helpful to have a few smaller assignments to wrestle with other concepts.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The instructor was responsive to emails. The TA made a point of following up if there were any lingering questions from review sessions.

Ann always made herself available to students outside of class and these one on one meetings were helpful.As the TA, Kris made himself available but was never that helpful. I understand that he's a PHD student and is busy but he never knew what was going on in class and review sessions were poorly run. I dont expect to get my hand held but compared to all of my other classes, his involvement and investment in the class was subpar. With that said, I thought he did a good job running the Great Mountain field trip.
TA was available, but was rarely up to date on class readings.
Ann was always available to answer questions and clarify concepts. Very responsive.
The professor's expectations were often unclear. The TA was generally available and helpful when sought out.
See above. Instructor was more available than TA, but instructions from both could be very unclear.
Both were very available and gave me great help and advice

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I'm interested in the relationship between forests and water, so this course was critical to understanding forests.
This was a pre requisite for a potential capstone class and coupled with silviculture I feel that it will give me a solid understanding of forest systems.
Absolutely necessary as a foundation to studying forestry.
I think that this class will be very helpful as I go on to other forestry classes. I think I will learn this information more fully as I apply stand dynamics to other classes.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: see above.
See above response.
To learn more about forests.
Absolutely necessary as a foundation to studying forestry.
Essential/required for course of study
It is a part of the MF degree

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes
Although the course was poorly executed, I really enjoyed the material covered.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: i didn't know what to expect
Yes
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: read more prior to class!

If your an MF or and MEM interested in land management you should take this course. Its lecture based but you do learn a lot and Ann knows a lot. Could the course be better? Sure, but overall its a good class.
Figure out which readings talked about what before the exams.
If you are interested in the subject matter, or an MF, you should take this class.
Have regular sessions with your TA to go over material and readings.Get together with classmates to discuss readingsDo the readings.Encourage the instructor to get you into the field more.
Ask lots of questions in class and try to make it as interactive as possible.
Create small reading groups, ask for opportunities to make discussions and lectures more interactive (small presentations, etc). Course sequence could be very monotonous.

Take a brief note of all the readings you do because you will need to know the important papers, their authors and punchline in the exams. COme exam time, it would be tough to reread and refresh your memory on all of them. Better to read through a synopsis in your notes!
Read the Oliver textbook. This should be required not optional for the course.
